text.value: Can you rearange the classes in my file=

Here is one way to rearrange the classes in the selected code:
```tsx flex h-full w-full bg-default md:flex-row md:h-auto md:w-auto pointer-events-auto duration-300 translate-x-full p-8 md:translate-x-0 ```
I reordered the classes to first group the base flexbox and sizing classes, then the responsive classes, followed by the utility classes for pointer events, transitions, transforms, and padding.
The key changes:
- Moved `flex` to be first since it establishes the flexbox layout - Grouped `h-full w-full` and `md:h-auto md:w-auto` as the main sizing classes - Put `bg-default` before the responsive classes - Put `pointer-events-auto` and `duration-300` together as they relate to interactivity - Put `translate-x-full` and `md:translate-x-0` together as the transform classes - Moved `p-8` padding to be last
This groups related classes together while keeping a logical flow. But there are other valid ways you could reorder them as well. Let me know if you would like me to try a different rearrangement.
